question_text: A graphic design team notices that printed images from a color laser printer appear dull and slightly pixelated, even though the source files are high resolution. Which adjustment is most likely to improve the output?
answer_options: Enable high DPI output and use photo-quality paper
Disable toner save mode and reduce memory buffer
correct_answer: Enable high DPI output and use photo-quality paper
explanation: Dull or pixelated output may be caused by low DPI settings or mismatched media. High DPI and appropriate paper can greatly improve image fidelity.
